[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@amadeus-it-group/kassette](./kassette.md) &gt; [CLIConfigurationSpec](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.md) &gt; [port](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.port.md)

## CLIConfigurationSpec.port property

The port on which the proxy should listen. Note that kassette accepts both http and https connections on this port.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
readonly port?: number;
```

## Remarks

If the port is not available, it will fail and stop the program; try again with another, available port. If the port is set to 0, the proxy will listen on a random port (actually depends on the OS implementation): use the callback [onListen](./kassette.configurationspec.onlisten.md) to catch its value.
